citation.article-title: Shinella granuli gen. nov., sp. nov., and proposal of the reclassification of Zoogloea ramigera ATCC 19623 as Shinella zoogloeoides sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Shinella (Shi.nel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Shinella named after Yong-Kook Shin, for his contributions to reclassification of the genus Zoogloea).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, motile rods.
Amorphous or finger-like flocculent growth occurs in liquid media.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and summed feature 7 (C18 : 1ω7c/ω9t/ω12t, C18 : 1ω7c/ω9c/ω12t) and C16 : 0 3-OH is the predominant hydroxy fatty acid.
16S rRNA gene sequence analysis indicates that the genus Shinella is a member of the family Rhizobiaceae of the Alphaproteobacteria.
The type species is Shinella granuli.
